page.title: 03Crock's Bottom, Emborough
page.content: Crock's Bottom is a wooded valley wich borders on Emborough and Gurney slade. It is a stretch of countryside where now only cattle nd wildlife roam but where once a thriving community lived, evidence of this is all around. Stone cottages are seen as ruins under the northern slope of the hill uninhabitd since the turn of the century. Ruined watercress beds are seen studded with white str like lowers of Water Fennel. The local church going inhabitants of Binegar and Gurey Slade enjoy an annual Rogation sunday athrough this lovely valley when the Parish Boundaries are walked, tramping the same tracks that once served that lost community of Crock's Bottom.
